channel.title: Retarted client
channel.description: yo yo i got a client no liein i cant even change that ip homi.. jk i was trying to make a ryme k i got a client right and its time to make people play but when i try to change ip i cant find where it is... can u help me?

item.title: Retarted client
item.dc:creator: @bhpkyeah satesql
item.description:
@bhpkyeah wrote:

Actually next time you want to find something, download notepad++, and open all the java files in your client folder, and cntr F… Choose Find in all open documents, and type 127.0.0.1 and it will show you exactly where it is… And that’s not just for him to know, you other guys should use notepad++ as well.

Read full topic

[/quote]

By the way its retard. Its in client.java, if you were smart you would look for “127.0.0.01” and look around there. Although the evidence from this thread points to the fact you aren’t at all intelligent.[/quote]

127.0.0.1

@badger41 wrote:

ur so fuckin dumb… i looked everywhere u dipshit its not there

like i just said though, if you have an common sense at all it would be not to flame people who try to help.

item.title: Retarted client
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

Look in EGUI.java for this:

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“YOURIPHERE”, “YOURIPHERE”, “YOURIPHERE”
});
}
}
[/code]

(That should be the whole EGUI.java)
Change ‘YOURIPHERE’ to Your IP.

Read full topic

item.title: Retarted client
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Owned_Pl0xs, post:4, topic:323569”][quote author=nikolaww3 link=topic=419973.msg3084886#msg3084886 date=1262443162]
yo yo i got a client no liein i cant even change that ip homi…
[/quote]

LOL, fuck 10 year olds get dumber every damn year.[/quote]

and your 10 year old comment isnt needed.

most clients use client.java, egui.java, or gui.java to handle the ip it connects to.

if your client is a base, the ip is most likely, 0.0.0.0, or 127.0.0.1, change those to whatever the ip you use.
